description:
One of the most exciting events in DC history is collected in this volume, reprinting the complex story taking place in our own 20th century and in the far-flung 853rd century — one million months after the publication of ACTION COMICS #1. This volume is a new printing of the previously released DC ONE MILLION collection.

Including the popular miniseries that tied the event together — written by Grant Morrison (JLA) with art by Val Semeiks and Prentis Rollins — this is the story of the JLA's first meeting with their successors, an encounter that nearly becomes their doom thanks to the machinations of the immortal Vandal Savage and the sentient super-computer Solaris, the Tyrant Sun. Reprinting DC ONE MILLION #1-4 and the #1,000,000 issues of JLA and STARMAN in their entirety, along with portions of the tie-in issues of DETECTIVE COMICS, GREEN LANTERN, RESURRECTION MAN, and SUPERMAN: THE MAN OF TOMORROW, the collection also includes text pages summarizing the nonreprinted tie-in issues.
name: One Million

description:
Overview:
 
This is a collection of graphic short stories which capture the visions of London, human and architectural, reflected in the city's puddles. Each story is set in a particular area of London, and brings together successful comic book writers to produce a mix of styles and disciplines.
name: It's Dark in London

description:
Overview:
 

The year is 2054, and life is reduced to a data feed. The fusing of virtual reality and cybernetics has ushered in the era of the personal surrogate, android substitutes that let users interact with the world without ever leaving their homes. It's a perfect world, and it's up to Detectives Harvey Greer and Pete Ford of the Metro Police Department to keep it that way. But to do so they’ll need to stop a techno-terrorist bent on returning society to a time when people lived their lives instead of merely experiencing them.

The Surrogates is a story about progress and whether there exists a tipping point at which technological advancement will stop enhancing and start hindering our lives. It is also a commentary on identity, the Western obsession with physical appearance, and the growing trend to use science as a means of providing consumers with beauty on demand.

This volume collects all five issues of the acclaimed comic book series. Packed with bonus content, inside you will find never-before-seen sketches and artwork, as well as commentary from the creative team that brought this breakout story to the page.
name: The Surrogates (Vol.1)

description:
Overview:

In a dark downtown alley in Central Georgia Metropolis, a juvenile prank goes too far and a homeless man is killed. When the ensuing investigation reveals that the attackers aren't who they appeared to be, justice depends on the testimony of a single witness -- a street snitch with a history of providing information to a uniformed cop named Harvey Greer. Harvey is placed on special assignment to track down the informant, but others have their own designs, including a wealthy socialite and an ex-con turned religious leader known to his followers as The Prophet. As days pass and anger among the anti-surrogate population grows, the city stands on a razor's edge. Will punishment be exacted in a courtroom... or on the streets?

Set fifteen years prior to the events of the first volume, The Surrogates: Flesh and Bone sheds light on the past that binds the cast together. From the streets of Central Georgia Metropolis to the boardroom of Virtual Self, Inc., it takes us on a journey through a city struggling to come to grips with its present. As much a cautionary tale as a story of suspense, this book reminds us that tomorrow will be determined by the choices we make today.
name: The Surrogates: Flesh and Bone

Overview

The fusing of virtual reality and cybernetics has ushered in the era of the personal surrogate, android substitutes that let users interact with the world without ever leaving their homes. This volume collects all five issues of the acclaimed comic book series. Packed with bonus content, inside you will find never-before-seen sketches and artwork, as well as commentary from the creative team that brought this breakout story to the page.
 
[Book 2]

In a dark downtown alley in Central Georgia Metropolis, a juvenile prank goes too far and a homeless man is killed. When the ensuing investigation reveals that the attackers aren't who they appeared to be, justice depends on the testimony of a single witness -- a street snitch with a history of providing information to a uniformed cop named Harvey Greer. Harvey is placed on special assignment to track down the informant, but others have their own designs, including a wealthy socialite and an ex-con turned religious leader known to his followers as The Prophet. As days pass and anger among the anti-surrogate population grows, the city stands on a razor's edge. Will punishment be exacted in a courtroom... or on the streets?

Set fifteen years prior to the events of the first volume, The Surrogates: Flesh and Bone sheds light on the past that binds the cast together. From the streets of Central Georgia Metropolis to the boardroom of Virtual Self, Inc., it takes us on a journey through a city struggling to come to grips with its present. As much a cautionary tale as a story of suspense, this book reminds us that tomorrow will be determined by the choices we make today.
name: The Surrogates Owner's Manual

description: Beaky Buzzard is hungry. He thinks he's found a nice meal in Daffy Duck, but the wacky bird has another suggestion: Bugs Bunny. So just who will be feeding the hungry buzzard family? A hint: It won't be the ever-cool Bugs! Poor Beaky doesn't stand a chance...
name: S'No Bunny Like A Snow Bunny; The Missing Link; Reach Out and Bugs Someone; Pet Peeved; For My Sweet-Tea

description:
1. By the Fright of the Silvery Moon!
 
2. Midnight Mess!
 
3. Busted Marriage!
 
4. This Wraps It Up!
name: By the Fright of the Silvery Moon!
Dick Tracy and the Famon Boys

volume.name: Dick Tracy and the Famon Boys

description: 1. Den Segrande (Batman, James Gordon, Robin,  Lois Lane, Alfred Pennyworth, Joker, Ellen Yindel, Mutants / written by Frank Miller)
name: Den Segrande

description:
Scorpion Sting!

Scorponok – the artificial arachnid of apocalyptic anarchy – crawls from the sands of Qatar to inflict maximum mayhem in the latest issue of TRANSFORMERS COMIC! Ironhide teams up with a human Special Forces squad to go in search of the elusive Decepticon, but who is hunting who?

Beast Wars: The Gathering Part 8

‘Beast Wars’ is about to defined as a concept in the latest part of Simon Furman’s brutal saga set on Prehistoric Earth, as Megatron’s minions come face-to-muzzle with a terrifying new ‘creature’! Also in this issue, the comic strip prequel to the TRANSFORMERS Movie continues!

Competitions

Each issue, we bring you news on the latest TRANSFORMERS merchandise, action figures and attire – and give you the chance to win it! This time around, get your mitts on the G.I.Joe Vs. TRANSFORMERS Omnibus, TRANSFORMERS caps, and season two of Beast Machines on DVD!

Reprints

Reprinted stories are only a portion of their respective issues.

  • Transformers: Movie Prequel, part 3b (7 pages)
  • Beast Wars: The Gathering, part 3b (8 pages)
name: Scorpion Sting

description:
Reprints

Reprinted stories are only a portion of their respective issues.

  • Transformers: Movie Prequel, part 3c (7 pages)
  • Beast Wars: The Gathering, part 3c (7 pages)
name: Twilight's Last Gleaming, Part: 1

description: Klaw and AIM are poised to conquer the earth with their unstoppable new weapon: THE SCREAM. The problem is that in order to defeat them, Shuri the new Black Panther has to break into DEAD AIM, the most secure facility on the planet. That kind of job needs finesse rather than savage aggression, so who better to help beat the unbeatable security system than the Black Widow. NY Times bestseller Jonathan Maberry and artist Gianluca Gugliotta rocket to an explosive conclusion of the new Black Panther's most critical mission.
name: Enter the Black Widow
La vera storia di King Kong

description:
Overview:
 
Lenore is America's favorite little dead girl. Part humor, part pathos, Lenore is a combination of cuteness and creepiness that tackles everyday life with a perverted innocence. The spooktacular swanky edition brings together the first four issues of Lenore, and some other cool swag!
name: Lenore: Noogies

description:
Overview:
 
Volume 2 of Lenore collects the next four issues of this triple-Eisner nominated series. Includes other Lenore-related tidbits, art, and introduction. Also features eight of 16 new pages in full color!
name: Lenore: Wedgies

description:
Overview:
 
Issue #12 presented in full-color, while the rest of the series is in Black and White
name: Lenore: Cooties

description:
Overview:
 
A massive cult hit since her debut in 1997, Roman Dirge's Lenore is one of the darkest, yet cutest characters in comics today. If you yearn for the gothic delights of Tim Burton's Nightmare Before Christmas or Emily the Strange, you can't afford to miss Lenore's antics in this brilliant series of newly-colored graphic novels, which have been meticulously revised and remastered by Roman Dirge himself! This volume collects the original Lenore comics in color for the first time and features a superb new cover!  
 

Preview Limited Edition:

  • Variant Cover
  • Contains 4 exclusive art prints 
  • Signed by Roman Dirge.
  • Contains extra material
name: LenoreL Noogies

description:
Overview:
 
Featuring stories about limbless cannibals, clock monsters, cursed vampire dolls, taxidermied friends, an obssessed would-be lover and more fuzzy animal mutilations than you can shake a stick at! The original black and white strip has been meticulously revised, recolored and restored by creator Roman Dirge himself!
name: Lenore: Wedgies

description:
Overview:
 
Return to the dark, surreal world of Lenore, the cute little dead girl with a knack for unintentional mayhem and occasional wanton destruction, in this third exclusive hardcover volume! She may be deceased, but she's determined to carry on exactly where she left off, being beastly to Mr. Gosh, accidentally squishing a variety of small cute animals, making friends with vampires and spam witches, and avoiding the armies of Heck. Featuring glorious full-color illustrations and a sick slew of grizzly and downright funny back-up strips
 
*Note: Neil Gaiman provides the forward.
 

Preview Limited Edition:

  • Variant Cover
  • Contains 4 exclusive art prints 
  • Signed by Roman Dirge.
  • Contains extra material
name: Lenore: Cooties
